ili.lights
Class LightEvent

java.lang.Object
  java.util.EventObject
      ili.lights.LightEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LightEvent
extends java.util.EventObject

The LightEvent is a subclass of EventObject and is thrown by light sources when any of their parameters change. If you want to capture events, be sure to implement LightListener and create a function public void lightEventReceived( event ); in your own class. Then register your class to the light source of choice by calling addLightListener( yourObject ) of that specific object.

See Also:

getSource

public java.lang.Object getSource()
Returns the source that passed this event. This needs to be converted to a Light, CCTLight or ColorLight object.
